Package simulation.mmsolve

Class QRdcmp

java.lang.Object
simulation.mmsolve.QRdcmp
public class QRdcmp extends Object
Performs QR matrix decomposition and solved linear SOEs Used for Broyden's method. Based on numerical recipes 3rd version and equations are references there

  • Constructor Details

    • QRdcmp

      public QRdcmp​(double[][] a)
      Construct the QR decomposition of a[0..n-1][0..n-1]. The upper triangular matrix R and the transpose of the orthogonal matrix Q are stored. sing is set to true if a singularity is encountered during the decomposition, but the decomposition is still completed in this case; otherwise it is set to false.
      Parameters:
      a - - the matrix to be decomposed

  • Method Details

    • qt

      public double[][] qt()
      Returns the matrix Q^T

    • r

      public double[][] r()
      Returns the matrix R

    • sing

      public boolean sing()
      Returns whether the matrix A is singular

    • SIGN

      public static double SIGN​(double a, double b)
      Returns a value with the same magnitude as a and the same sign as b.

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[] b, double[] x) throws Exception
      Solve the set of n linear equations A*x = b.
      Parameters:
      b - - input as the right-hand side vector b[0..n-1]
      x - - returned as the solution vector x[0..n-1]
      Throws:
      Exception

    • qtmult

      public void qtmult​(double[] b, double[] x)
      Multiply Q^T*b and put the result in x. Since Q is orthogonal, this is equivalent to solving Q*x=b for x.
      Parameters:
      b - - input as the right-hand side vector b[0..n-1]
      x - - returned as the solution vector x[0..n-1]

    • rsolve

      public void rsolve​(double[] b, double[] x) throws Exception
      Solve the triangular set of n linear equations R*x=b.
      Parameters:
      b - b[0..n-1] is input as the right-hand side vector
      x - x[0..n-1] is returned as the solution vector.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • update

      public void update​(double[] u, double[] v)
      Starting from the stored QR decomposition A=Q*R, update it to be the QR decomposition of the matrix Q*(R + u \otimes v).
      Parameters:
      u - - left vector in outer product that is added to R
      v - - right vector in outer product that is added to R

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(int i, double a, double b)
      Utility used by update(double[], double[]). Given matrices r[0..n-1][0..n-1] and qt[0..n-1][0..n-1], carry out a Jacobi rotation on rows i and i+1 of each matrix. the rotation: cos(\theta) = a/\sqrt{a^2 + b^2}, sin(\theta) = b/\sqrt{a^2 + b^2}
      Parameters:
      i - - row to rotate
      a - - rotation parameter
      b - - rotation parameter
